Responsible Consumption and Production.reason: The course analyzes 'Consumer Choice' and 'Firms and Production,' providing the framework to understand consumption and production patterns. 'Externalities' are key to addressing unsustainable practices.

Partnerships for the Goals.reason: The course includes topics on 'Macroeconomics in an Open Economy' and 'The International Financial System,' which directly address global economic cooperation and partnerships.
